answers.answer: Can your doctor send you to a diabetes educator? This question cannot easily be properly answered on line.In short the lantus is taken once or twice every 24 hours as a basal insulin.  Aphidra is a fast acting insulin used to prevent blood sugar rises from food.  It is taken before meals based on how many carbs are eaten.You can go to bernstein diabetes university on utube for some more info.  However please do ask your Dr for education / referral to diabetes educator.  Insulin is a very effective medication but it must be used properly in order for it to be safe.
